intro: Gilia septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Gilia septentrionalis is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to arid environments.
